revised_title: Advancements in Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy Gene Cloning and Diagnosis
tldr: Researchers have successfully cloned the gene responsible for Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) using knowledge of its map location on the X-chromosome. This discovery has led to the development of DNA probes that can be used for carrier identification and prenatal diagnosis, as well as providing a better understanding of the disease and potential avenues for therapy or a cure.
